nodes.text: The Torch Nebula, also known as the Torch sector, was a large nebula within the Outer Rim Territories. It formed a sector that contained the Piluvia system and was crossed by the Llanic Spice Run and Five Veils Route hyperlanes.

By 3640 BBY, some biologists believed the Torch Nebula contained the homeworld of the amphibian lurker creatures. During the reign of the Galactic Empire, the sector was governed by Moff Pelles, and by that time, the spectacular view of the nebula in the nearby planet Shownar's sky served as a major attraction for tourists.

The Torch Nebula, also referred to as the Torch sector, was an expansive nebulosity that was located within the Outer Rim Territories. It was composed of various gases and chemical elements related to the makeup of stars and was considered a celestial oddity. The nebula dominated the night sky of the nearby Parmic sector's planet Shownar, where it manifested as a spectacular display of fiery blue and red lights.

The Torch Nebula contained the Piluvia system, which shared its name with the phenomenon known as the Piluvian salamander-storm. At the edges of the nebula lay a nameless jungle world, which, by approximately 3640 BBY, was believed by biologists serving the Hutt Cartel to be the homeworld of the bipedal amphibians known as lurkers.

By 0 ABY, the Torch Nebula constituted a regional sector of the Galactic Empire and was governed by Moff Pelles. The nebula bordered the Parmic sector Coreward and the Thuris sector spinward and Rimward, while sharing the trailing border with the Sujimis sector. The Llanic Spice Run hyperlane passed through the sector, as did a segment of the Five Veils Route.

During the time period between 0 ABY and 4 ABY, Moff Pelles wished for a higher level of security in the Torch Nebula given that the vital Llanic Spice Run crossed the sector's borders. Pelles voiced those concerns in the form of criticism aimed at Moff Abran Balfour and his lack of involvement in governing the Parmic sector, which contained the endpoint of the Llanic Spice Run.

The Torch Nebula was considered to be the most impressive sight for tourists on Shownar during that time, with the planet's renowned Nebula Hotel offering a breathtaking view of the celestial phenomenon. The remarkable imagery caused by the nebula in Shownar's skies was made famous by a highly popular line of souvenir holocubes created by Shownar's preeminent businessman, Oro Freatt.

Dr. Callow Batta, a former professor of governmental and political history at the University of Sanbra who had turned to piracy after he had been fired by Imperial authorities, led a successful raid on a Galaxy Tours cruiser within the Torch Nebula at some point between 1 ABY and 2 ABY.

The Torch Nebula was first mentioned in Galaxy Guide 9: Fragments from the Rim, a 1993 sourcebook written by Simon Smith and Eric S. Trautmann for West End Games' Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game. The 2009 reference book The Essential Atlas placed the nebula within grid square P-19.

The 1995 Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game sourcebook Alliance Intelligence Reports introduced the "Torch sector." Given that The Essential Atlas Extra: Outer Rim Sectors depicts the Torch Nebula as a sector, this article assumes that the two terms are synonymous.
